function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Failure to comply with social distancing and staying at home measures"},{"name":"Lack of substantive moral support for the measures"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with mitigation measures such as staying home and social distancing"},{"name":"Ignoring the possibility of a new spike in cases by easing up with measures"},{"name":"Trust in science predicts compliance with covid-19 measures"},{"name":"Fear of covid-19 associated with increased compliance"},{"name":"Economic endowments influence compliance with stay-at-home measures"},{"name":"Variation in compliance globally"},{"name":"Association of political orientation with compliance"},{"name":"Rapid spread of the sars-cov-2 virus globally"},{"name":"Lack of data on the health status of employees"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and training on hygiene and disease prevention"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and indoor air quality"},{"name":"Lack of access requirements explicitly mentioned for policy measures"},{"name":"Identification of non-unique policy measures in different media reports"},{"name":"Existential threat to companies in case of prolonged sales decline"},{"name":"Retrieving 536 media reports from the database nexis could expose individuals to potentially contagious diseases if the database was accessed in a high-risk environment."},{"name":"Analyzing 152 articles for policy measures could pose a risk of exposure to contagious diseases if the analysis is conducted in a high-risk environment."},{"name":"Testing interrater reliability and refining criteria among researchers could increase the risk of disease transmission in case of close collaboration in a high-risk environment."},{"name":"Unsanitary interview conditions may promote the spread of contagious diseases"},{"name":"Close proximity during interviews may increase the risk of disease transmission"},{"name":"Extended data collection process may expose interviewees and interviewers to multiple sources of contagion"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases during in-person interviews and meetings"},{"name":"Lack of funding for future research on the impact of contagious diseases"},{"name":"Inadequate preparation for future economic crises related to contagious diseases"},{"name":"Lack of support for startups and entrepreneurial ecosystems during the covid-19 crisis"},{"name":"Exchange of information in online crisis groups could lead to the spread of misinformation and incorrect advice regarding disease management."},{"name":"Communicating intention for startup specific support early may lead to the gathering of large groups of individuals in physical spaces, increasing the risk of disease transmission."},{"name":"Perception of entrepreneurial opportunity during crisis"},{"name":"Adversity and coping strategies in startups"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19 pandemic"},{"name":"Lack of specific policy measures for startups"},{"name":"The presence of fewer than 100 cases of covid-19 in some countries may lead to a false sense of security and reduce the urgency of implementing effective measures to mitigate the spread of the virus."},{"name":"Reliance on short-term aid measures may create dependency on government support and hinder long-term resilience and sustainability of smes and startups."},{"name":"Reduction in loan interest rates and loan availability may lead to increased borrowing and debt burden for smes and startups, potentially creating financial instability in the future."},{"name":"High level of entrepreneurship pre-crisis"},{"name":"Post-disaster entrepreneurs contributing to recovery"},{"name":"Relying solely on entrepreneurial initiative to fix economic damage triggered by lockdown measures"},{"name":"Startups relying heavily on relational capabilities may lead to increased risk of disease propagation through close contact and interaction with partners and the startup community."},{"name":"Perceived mismatch between startup characteristics and government support services can lead to a lack of access to necessary resources for maintaining health and safety standards."},{"name":"Cognizance of customers' shifting needs may lead to increased risk of disease spread if startups are unable to adapt and respond to changes in customer behavior."},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation and flexibility"},{"name":"Unpreparedness for the impact of covid-19 on entrepreneurial activities"},{"name":"Reduced sales and fixed costs threatening startups' liquidity and long-term survival."},{"name":"Economic climate is unfavorable for innovation due to the covid-19 crisis."},{"name":"Decreased effectiveness of travel restrictions in widespread outbreak"},{"name":"Balancing public health benefits with negative impacts on freedom of movement, economy, and society"},{"name":"Cases with no known travel history contributing to disseminating sars-cov-2 outside of wuhan"},{"name":"Containment of respiratory infections characterized by mild symptoms or pre-symptomatic transmission"},{"name":"Scant travel history information for some provinces , zhejiang and guangdong"}]}
